Key Arguments: The proposed legislation represents a tyrannical overreach of government power.
Government and regulatory agencies are often the source of misinformation or disinformation.
Society should be able to hear all views and determine truth for themselves.
The legislation is seen as an attempt to silence dissenting voices.
There is a lack of trust in government and regulatory officials to determine what constitutes misinformation.
Notable Quotes: The tyrannical overreach of government is what poses a threat to the safety and wellbeing of Australians.
Society needs to be able to hear all views and determine for themselves what to be truth or disinformation.
Most of the disinformation or misinformation is coming from the government or other regulatory agencies.
